quotes.quote: The best thing about being a static image in a vid is you can't be busted for plagiarism.
Discipline defines each of the relations that the body must have with the object that it manipulates...[in] what might be called the instrumental coding of the body. - Michel Foucault

A body is docile that may be subjected, used, transformed and improved. The celebrated automata, on the other hand, were not only a way of illustrating an organism, they were also political puppets, small-scale models of power... - Michel Foucault

The analysis - and self-analysis - of the total body, the way in which that body locates itself and the way in which it becomes fragmented, all are determined by a practice which includes discourse but which cannot be reduced to it. - Henri Lefebvre
The fetishism of an abstract economics is being transformed into the fetishism of an abstract economic space. - Henri Lefebvre
The normal derives its disciplinary force from the way it obscures its political partiality behind an appearance of scientific impartiality. - Cryle and Stephens
To normalize is to impose a requirement on existence. - Cryle and Stephens

Commonly we find that upward mobility involves the presentation of proper performances and that efforts to move upward and efforts to keep from moving downward are expressed in terms of sacrifices made for the maintenance of front. - Erving Goffman

[W]e tend to blind ourselves to the fact that everyday secular performances in our own Anglo-American society must often pass a strict test of aptness, fitness, propriety, and decorum. - Erving Goffman
A certain bureaucratization of the spirit is expected so that we can be relied upon to give a perfectly homogenous performance at every appointed time. - Erving Goffman
The monitor screen has become the retina of temporal reality. This is why I only appear as a static image in interweb vids.
Headmon is not the name I was born with, it's my avatar name. We all have special names, avatar names designed resonate with the new media reality.
whatever appears on the television screen emerges as raw experience  for those who watch it. Therefore, television is reality and reality is less than television. - Professor Brian O'Blivion
Don't be afraid to let your body die. - Nikki Brand

There was a type of employee at the beginning of the Industrial Revolution whose job and livelihood largely vanished in the early 20th century. This was the horse....The population of working horses actually peaked in England long after the Industrial Revolution, in 1901, when 3.25 million were at work...but the arrival of the internal combustion engine in the late nineteenth century rapidly displaced these workers, so that by 1924 there were fewer than 2 million. There was always a wage at which all these horses could have remained employed. But that wage was so low that it did not pay for their feed. - Gregory Clark
Immortality is only for the young.

Bibliography.Title: The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life
Bibliography.Author: Erving Goffman
